page.title: 02CALOW
page.content: CALOW The Parish of Calow covers a huge area and includes Calow-a small township of almost 3000 people,a suburb of Chesterfield,but in N.E.Derbyshire, Arkwright and Duckmanton-mining areas and Sutton-a small village. The area was occupied before the Normans as part of the Parish of Chesterfield.Original spelling was Kalehal which means bare corner of land and suggests the worst part of the Manor.There are early references to a John Calow living in the area.He was probably a cloth manufacturer or merchant,who also owned some of the land.Records show that linen,woollen cloth and silver were stolen from his home and sheep from his land.
